meanings.definition: To predict or foretell the future.
meanings.sent1: The wise old man could auspicate the weather by observing the clouds.
meanings.sent2: She tried to auspicate her chances of winning the lottery by reading her horoscope.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to auspicate the future by staring at a crystal ball.
meanings.sent4: The farmer could auspicate a good harvest by the color of the leaves on the trees.
meanings.sent5: The fortune teller could auspicate the future with uncanny accuracy.

meanings.definition: To initiate or inaugurate with ceremonies or omens.
meanings.sent1: The priest would auspicate the new year with a special ceremony.
meanings.sent2: The tribal chief would auspicate the hunt by performing a ritual dance.
meanings.sent3: The children decided to auspicate their secret club with a secret handshake.
meanings.sent4: The captain auspicated the voyage with a toast to safe travels.
meanings.sent5: The queen auspicated the royal wedding with a grand procession.
